trans-unit.source: Describes how a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline"></xref> repeats its simple duration.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> structure with the specified iteration count.
A number greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the number of iterations to make.
count evaluates to infinity, a value that is not a number, or is negative.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> structure with the specified repeat duration.
The total length of time that the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline"></xref> should play (its active duration).
duration evaluates to a negative number.
Gets the number of times a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline"></xref> should repeat.

To avoid throwing an exception when accessing this property, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior.HasCount%2A> property first to verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior> represents an iteration count, not a repeat duration.
For more information about making a timeline repeat, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The numeric value representing the number of iterations to repeat.
This <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> describes a repeat duration, not an iteration count.
Gets the total length of time a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline"></xref> should play.

To avoid throwing an exception when accessing this property, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior.HasDuration%2A> property first to verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior> represents a repeat duration.
For more information about making a timeline repeat, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The total length of time a timeline should play.
This <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> does not describe a repeat duration; it describes an iteration count.
Indicates whether this instance is equal to the specified object.
The object to compare with this instance.
if value is a that represents the same repeat behavior as this instance; otherwise, .
Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref>.
The value to compare to this instance.
if both the type and repeat behavior of repeatBehavior are equal to this instance; otherwise, .
Indicates whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> structures are equal.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if both the type and repeat behavior of repeatBehavior1 are equal to that of repeatBehavior2; otherwise, .
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> that specifies an infinite number of repetitions.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> that specifies an infinite number of repetitions.
Returns the hash code of this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets a value that indicates whether the repeat behavior has a specified iteration count.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified type refers to an iteration count; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the repeat behavior has a specified repeat duration.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified type refers to a repeat duration; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> instances are equal.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if both the type and repeat behavior of repeatBehavior1 are equal to that of repeatBehavior2; otherwise, .
Indicates whether the two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> instances are not equal.
The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
if repeatBehavior1 and repeatBehavior2 are different types or the repeat behavior properties are not equal; otherwise .
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
The format to use.

-or- A null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.
The provider to use to format the value.

-or- A null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
Returns a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> instance.
A string representation of this instance.
Returns a string representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior"></xref> instance with the specified format.
The format used to construct the return value.
A string representation of this instance.
